__e: Now you stay down here, and I'll go up and be charming.
Honey, I have seen you charm your way into and out of so many, many things, but it might be a good idea to bring someone with you who knows something-- anything-- about music.
They'd come in, I'd turn on the charm and I'd make the sale every time.
I am sure I speak for the entire crew when I say we will always remember your grace and courage.
Well, I guess some people are born lucky, and the rest of us just have to make do with good looks and charm?
[Whining Continues] All right, he has some charm and he knows some tricks, but he's not for you: he's not your sort.
You have the bad luck of having some charm, and...
You've been walking around your whole life... like all this happened 'cause of your hard work... your good luck, your charm.
Give me a chance! I haven't had a single free moment to show you how charming I can be.
Oh, you've got that immortal charm going for you, I know, but none of them have ever gone anywhere, Henry.
The woman has a charm that goes way beyond the fact that she's just... stunning.
But you have a charm everyone else here seems to respond to.
It's just the first time I couldn't charm my way out of one of these things.
Not really. I figure it's a part of my charm.
Bound to happen. Bound to happen.
New York's charm is it makes you think you can have them.
Charm is all well and good but, in the real world, knowledge is power.
